text: The Rheinsteig is a hiking trail following a mainly elevated path along the east bank of the Rhine River in Germany. Its route stretches from Bonn to Wiesbaden, running parallel to the Rheinhöhenweg Trail and Rheinburgenweg Trail. ==Description== Rheinsteig trail marker The Rheinsteig passes through woodlands and vineyards, and has challenging ascents and descents. It is signposted by signs with an 'R' on a blue background. The Rheinsteig allows either longer-distance hiking or a number of short tours. == Route and sights of interest == *Wiesbaden-Biebrich, Schloss Biebrich, Schloss Biebrich Wiesbaden-Schierstein, Goethestein, Burg Frauenstein, Burg Frauenstein Wiesbaden-Frauenstein *Schlangenbad, Schlangenbad Burg Scharfenstein, Kiedrich, *Eberbach Abbey (Kloster Eberbach), Eberbach Abbey Steinberg, Schloss Vollrads *Johannisberg (Geisenheim), Schloss Johannisberg, *Marienthal Monastery, Eibingen Abbey, *Rüdesheim am Rhein, Niederwalddenkmal, Niederwalddenkmal Assmannshausen *Lorch, Ruine Nollig, Burg Gutenfels Burg Gutenfels *Kaub, Dörscheid, Lorelei *Sankt Goarshausen, Nochern, Burg Maus *Kestert, Lykershausen, Burg Liebenstein, Burg Sterrenberg, Burg Sterrenberg Filsen *Osterspai, Osterspai Marksburg *Braubach *Lahnstein, Oberlahnstein, Niederlahnstein, Lahneck Castle Lahneck Castle *Koblenz-Ehrenbreitstein, Ehrenbreitstein Fortress Ehrenbreitstein Fortress *Vallendar *Sayn (part of Bendorf) *Rengsdorf *Leutesdorf *Rheinbrohl *Leubsdorf, Linz am Rhein *Unkel Unkel *Bad Honnef, Drachenfels *Königswinter *Niederdollendorf *Kennedy Bridge, Kennedy Bridge Bonn ==Literature and maps== Opened on September 8, 2005, hikers can find maps and books giving information about where to join and leave the track, should hikers want to do just a short section. {| class="wikitable collapsible collapsed" |- !
